alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 12:57PM PDT until further notice by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Rainfall has decreased over the region, but flooding is ongoing. Rain may intensity again this afternoon. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, San Luis Obispo. * WHEN...Until 315 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of roadways, creeks, and streams are expected. In addition, there is an ongoing significant risk of mud and rockslides, especially on canyon roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1226 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated light to moderate rain. Multiple road closures due to flooding have been reported throughout the county. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen since last night. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected through this afternoon, highest in the coastal foothills. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... San Luis Obispo, Paso Robles, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Cambria, Santa Margarita, Black Mountain, Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade, and Templeton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
